thread.title: Mercy Corps Names Dara Royer Chief Development and Marketing Officer
thread.title_full: Mercy Corps Names Dara Royer Chief Development and Marketing Officer - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Mercy Corps Names Dara Royer Chief Development and Marketing Officer
text:
Mercy Corps
Royer to lead global organization's resource development team
PORTLAND, Ore. , Oct. 5, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Mercy Corps has appointed Dara Royer to the position of Chief Development and Marketing Officer. In this role, Royer will lead Mercy Corps' fundraising, marketing and communications teams to advance the work of Mercy Corps in over 40 countries.
"By connecting the talents of a highly skilled team of dynamic professionals, Dara will deepen the impact of Mercy Corps programs worldwide," says Neal Keny-Guyer , chief executive officer at Mercy Corps. "Dara brings invaluable experience that will help our teams work even better together to empower people to recover from crisis, build better lives and transform communities for good."
Royer joined Mercy Corps in 2013 from ALSAC/St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, where she served as Vice President of Brand Marketing. Prior to St. Jude, Royer served on a number of marketing and fundraising leadership roles, including Senior Vice President of Corporate and Community Affairs at Cook Children's Healthcare System. She started her career as a television journalist in several large U.S. markets and was recognized with both Emmy and Associated Press awards.
Royer succeeds Jeremy Barnicle , who will remain with Mercy Corps as a senior advisor to the CEO and the Global Leadership Council .
ABOUT MERCY CORPS
Global organization dedicated to helping people survive and communities thrive Working on the toughest challenges in over 40 countries around the world 42 million people benefiting from Mercy Corps' humanitarian assistance and economic development programs About 4,000 team members; in the field, 92 percent are from the countries where they work Over five years, average 88 percent of revenue channeled directly into programs; $382.6 million in operating revenue in FY2014 Founded in 1979 Logo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20110818/DC54665LOGO-a
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/mercy-corps-names-dara-royer-chief-development-and-marketing-officer-300154310.html
